snippet: The Consumer Price Index rose 0.4 percent in May, the largest increase since February 2013, according to the Labor Department.
abstract: Labor Dept reports that Consumer Price index rose 0.4 percent in May, marking largest increase since February 2013; shift, coinciding with surge in gas prices, suggests fading impact of lower oil prices on inflation.
lead_paragraph: The Consumer Price Index rose 0.4 percent in May, the largest increase since February 2013, according to the Labor Department.

headline.main: U.S. Consumer Prices Post Largest Gain in More Than 2 Years
headline.print_headline: Consumer Prices Climb as Gas Prices Jump
